column1: #Text=SCOTT, with sentiments of gratitude and • respect, returns bis sincere thanks to tha Nobility, Gentry, Commercial Gentlemen, and the Public generally, for favors conferred, and assures them that no attention shall be wanting on his part to render his Establishment replete with every comfort, which being combined with moderate charges, fcs flatters himself will ensure hiss their future patronage. •#* The Stables, having been re-built,will be found superior.
#Text=An Ordinary every day at one oclock.

#Text=The following COACHES leave the above INN, vis.: The MAGNET for LONDON, every morning at a quarter before 5; arrives at Hatchets New White Hone Cellar, tbs same evening at 8; the Saracens Need, Snow Hill, and the Belle Sausage, Ludgate Hill, at* o’dock; leaves the latter named Inna every morning at i ocleok j and the New Whit*, Hone Cellar, at S.
#Text=A COACH to SOUTHAMPTON, every morning at a quarter befoee 5.
#Text=A COACH to BATH, Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, at half.ptst 7 oclock.
#Text=Who will not be accountable for any Parcels, or Passengers Luggage, above the value of Five Pounds, unless entered as each and paid for accordingly, at any of their offices, in town or country.
#Text=POST-OFFICE PACKETS sail for GUERNSEY and JERSEY every Wednesday and Saturday evenings, about K o’clock, and return every Tuesday and Saturday.
#Text=A VAN to BATH every Tuesday, and BRISTOL on Thursday.
